title: Wire up OpenCode SDK connection in apps/web
description:
## Context

Setting up SDK connection to OpenCode server. Current state:

### Files Created
- `apps/web/src/core/client.ts` - SDK client factory wrapper
- `apps/web/src/core/poc.ts` - POC script to test connection

### SDK Installed
- `@opencode-ai/sdk@1.0.203` in apps/web

### SDK API (from ADR)
```typescript
const client = createOpencodeClient({ baseUrl, directory })

// Namespaces:
client.session.list()      // CRUD, messages, prompt
client.provider.list()     // AI providers
client.project.current()   // Current project
client.config.get()        // Config
client.global.event()      // SSE subscription
// ... 15+ namespaces total
```

### Challenges
1. OpenCode server runs on random port
2. Server needs to run from a project directory (has Instance context)
3. POC script tries to spawn server and capture port from output

### Next Steps
- Fix POC to properly spawn server and parse port
- Or: accept port as env var for dev (simpler)
- Wire up React hooks in src/react/
- SSE subscription for real-time updates
